meanings.sent1: The exanimate room felt cold and empty.
meanings.sent2: The doll's exanimate eyes stared blankly ahead.
meanings.sent3: The exanimate plant needed some sunlight to liven up.
meanings.sent4: Her exanimate expression mirrored her inner sadness.
meanings.sent5: The exanimate street at night was eerie and unsettling.

meanings.sent1: After the long hike, he felt exanimate and drained.
meanings.sent2: The exanimate performance failed to captivate the audience.
meanings.sent3: The exanimate party needed some music to liven things up.
meanings.sent4: Her exanimate response showed her lack of interest.
meanings.sent5: The exanimate atmosphere in the room made everyone yawn.

meanings.definition: To deprive of life or animation.
meanings.sent1: The evil sorcerer sought to exanimate the enchanted forest.
meanings.sent2: The villain's plan was to exanimate all the heroes in the story.
meanings.sent3: The magician accidentally exanimated his own hat during the trick.
meanings.sent4: The curse threatened to exanimate the entire kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The dark magic aimed to exanimate the once lively town square.
